While recent research has shown that pain produces pathological changes to the brain and spinal cord, many doctors and patients still labor under misguided cultural notions and outdated scientific dogmas that prevent proper treatment, to devastating effect.In The Pain Chronicles, a singular and deeply humane work, Melanie Thernstrom traces conceptions of pain throughout the ages—from ancient Babylonian pain-banishing spells to modern brain imaging—to reveal the elusive, mysterious nature of pain itself. Interweaving first-person reflections on her own battle with chronic pain, incisive reportage from leading-edge pain clinics and medical research, and insights from a wide range of disciplines—science, history, religion, philosophy, anthropology, literature, and art—Thernstrom shows that when dealing with pain we are neither as advanced as we imagine nor as helpless as we may fear.Both a personal meditation and an intellectual exploration, The Pain Chronicles illuminates and makes sense of the all-too-human experience of pain—and confronts with extraordinary grace and empathy its peculiar traits, its harrowing effects, and its various antidotes.

Title: Governing States and Localities, 2nd Edition
Authors: By Smith, Kevin B., Greenblatt, Alan, and Mariani, Michele
Description: Smith (U. of Nebraska at Lincoln), Greenblatt (Governing magazine), and Mariani (Pew Center on the States) present the second edition of an undergraduate-level introductory textbook on state and local government in the United States. Chapters cover federalism and state constitution; political attitudes and participation; parties and interest groups; legislatures, executives, courts, and the bureaucracy; the structure, authority, and responsibilities of local government; regional relations among local governments; and the policy areas of finance, education, criminal justice, and health and welfare. The new edition is updated to include analysis of recent legislative and gubernatorial elections, state supreme court decisions and constitutional debates, changes in campaign and elections regulations, demographic changes of immigration and aging, and events and issues such as Hurricane Katrina and climate change. Annotation ©2008 Book News, Inc., Portland, OR (booknews.com)

Title: Merriam-Webster's French-English Dictionary, Newest Edition, Mass-Market Paperback (English and French Edition)
Description: "A bilingual, bidirectional guide to French and North American English with extensive coverage of Canadian French.  More than 80,000 entries and 100,000 translations. Abundant examples of words used in context."

Title: 400 Calorie Fix Cookbook 400 All-new Simply Satisfying Meals
Effective Writing: A Handbook for Accountants
Authors: By May, Claire B., Ph.D. and May, Gordon S.
Description: The best-selling book of its kind, discusses the communication, both written and oral, actually done by professional accountants.It uses real-world accounting situations and includes major sections on Communication Strategies, Business Documents, and Oral Communication. This book is written for the accountant who wants to sharpen their communication and critical thinking skills in order to be more effective in the workplace.  For Accounting, Business Communication, and Technical Writing courses.

Title: Making Globalization Work
Description: The Nobel Prize-winning economist and leading critic of globalization offers a fresh new approach to the issue that explains how to restructure an unstable global financial system, how nations can grow economically without damaging the environment, and how to devise a framework for free and fair global trade. Reprint. 25,000 first printing.

Title: Barron's AP Calculus (Barron's: The Leader in Test Preparation)
Authors: By Bock, David and Hockett, Shirley O.
Description: Both Calculus AB and Calculus BC are covered in this comprehensive AP test preparation manual. Prospective test takers will find four practice exams in Calculus AB and four more in Calculus BC, with all questions answered and solutions explained. The manual also provides a detailed 10-chapter review covering topics for both exams. The authors also offer an overview of the AP Calculus exams, which includes advice to students on making best use of their graphing calculators.
